Comment: Definition: A realizable entity (snap:RealizableEntity) that essentially causes a specific process or transformation in the object (snap:Object) in which it inheres
under specific circumstances and in conjunction with the laws of nature. A general formula for dispositions is: X (object (snap:Object) has the disposition D to (transform
initiate a process) R under conditions C.
Examples: the disposition of vegetables to decay when not refrigerated
the disposition of a vase to brake if dropped
the disposition of blood to coagulate
the disposition of a patient with a weakened immune system to contract disease
